value.title: GM Self-Driving Company Hires Former Delta Executive as COO
value.excerpt: Cruise LLC, the self-driving car startup majority owned by General Motors Co., has hired former Delta Air Lines Inc. Chief Operating Officer Gil West for the same position as it prepares to start offering paid robotaxi rides in San Francisco.

value.title: Ambarella unveils 8K AI vision processor for car, drone, and robot cameras
value.excerpt: Ambarella has unveiled the CV5 AI Vision Processor to handle 8K image processing for car, consumer, crone, and robot cameras.

value.title: Outlandish Stanford facial recognition study claims there are links between facial features and political orientation
value.excerpt: A controversial study from Stanford-affiliated researchers claims to find links between facial features and political affiliation.

value.title: Agdhi to use machine learning and computer vision in agriculture

value.title: Baidu teams up with Geely to create new self-driving car company
value.excerpt: The Chinese search giant will focus on the intelligent driving side of things while Geely will bring its manufacturing capabilities to the table.

value.title: Leveraging AI In Remote Talent Acquisition
value.excerpt: AI has made headlines for the last few years, but after the new normal of remote work was accelerated in 2020, it has been more of an impact on remote talent acquisitions.

value.title: AI Weekly: The future of tech policy after an attempted coup

value.title: Equifax will pay $640 million for Kount’s AI-driven identity and fraud prevention tools
value.excerpt: Equifax will pay $640 million to acquire Kount which uses artificial intelligence to drive its fraud prevention and digital identity services.

value.title: Why everyone is talking about an image generator released by an Elon Musk-backed A.I. lab

value.title: AI-enabled Mercedes-Benz Hyperscreen takes the digital dashboard to the next level
value.excerpt: The 56-inch curved screen extends nearly the full extension of the dashboard, serving as an "attentive assistant for the passenger," and can store multiple front passenger profiles for personalized experiences.

value.title: World’s Fastest Optical Neuromorphic Processor for Artificial Intelligence
value.excerpt: Headed by the Swinburne University of Technology, an international research team has now revealed the world’s fastest and most robust optical neuromorphic processor meant for artificial intelligence (AI).

value.title: Five ways to make AI a greater force for good in 2021
value.excerpt: A year ago, none the wiser about what 2020 would bring, I reflected on the pivotal moment that the AI community was in. 2018 had seen a series of high-profile automated failures, like self-driving car crashes and discriminatory recruiting tools.

value.title: Self-Driving Cars And The Newest ‘Move Over, Slow Down’ Laws
value.excerpt: The law and prudent driving dictate that you should move over and slow down when nearing stranded vehicles on the side of the road, which is easier to say than for self-driving cars to achieve.
